title: Erigon couldn't recover from bad block.
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `2.34.0-dev-cfb0d99c` (devel) with embed light client
OS & Version: debian
Commit hash : cfb0d99cfad8868b73589bb9e16d64368c83ea52
Chain: `mainnet`


Erigon found a bad block and couldnt recover. At the start it looks like it was syncing, but RPC was notified every 10 blocks, then it completely lost sync.
I tried a restart, erigon synced bodies, but it looks like it was not progressing on execution stage.
I tried to unwind some blocks but after syncing some time the same keeps happening.

This happened to me the other day, by "light client" I am assuming you are referring to the embedded CL. Would have been nice to confirm this by seeing your config and/or command line params.

It seems after going out of sync a few days (or possibly hours, or maybe in your case minutes due to rollback) it struggles to work again. The fix is to temporarily point to a external CL such as Nimbus, Lighthouse etc.. Using embedded CL for me has managed to get back in and remain in sync after ~15m server reboots and maintenance.

Now you are resyncing from scratch worth informing you that this might also happen once your initial sync round is complete, it won't progress. This happened to me. The fix is the same, use external CL and only use embedded once fully synced.
